meanings.definition: To flow together or into one another
meanings.sent1: The rivers interflowed, merging into a single stream.
meanings.sent2: The colors interflowed seamlessly in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The ingredients interflowed in the recipe, creating a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: Their ideas interflowed, sparking new innovations.
meanings.sent5: The music interflowed, filling the room with harmony.

meanings.sent1: The streams interflowed yesterday, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The conversations interflowed naturally during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The memories interflowed in his mind, bringing a sense of nostalgia.
meanings.sent4: Their paths interflowed at the crossroads of fate.
meanings.sent5: The colors interflowed in the sunset, painting the sky with hues of orange and pink.
